notesStmt.note: Defective at the beginning and at the end. Lacunae after folios 8, 18, 66, 75, 116, 136. Folios 116-143 are later additions.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Piyuṭim for Shavu῾ot with the Ten Commandments

collation.p: Indeterminable (the manuscript is very fragmentary). Only a few of quire signatures in Hebrew letters have been preserved.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental (Karaite) semi-cursive script of the 18th century.

binding.p: BL/BM in-house. Spine: 'Karaite Piyutim. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2534.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 08 July 1882: inscribed, folio [144v].
